ygData.subject: Re: Into the LIGHT!
ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson gets up and nodds to Stanton.  He understood that this was critical, and doesn t hesitate to follow his advice. Of course Stanton, parden my intrusion.

Tucson gets up and nodds to Stanton.  He understood that this was critical,=
 and doesn't hesitate to follow his advice.

"Of course Stanton, parden my =
intrusion.  I'll be in the ovbservation room. If you need to perform any en=
ergy transfusions I will be happy to volunteer as your donor."

He now leav=
es with Talon and Perceptor.  Deep down he was furious at what Hydras had u=
ltimately put Rodimus through.  If it weren't for Hydras, Rodimus would hav=
e never been trapped beneath those tunnels, or have become a meal for the g=
iant insectoids which had feasted on his own energy.  He was also furious f=
or the suffering which Nightlight, Windlord and Perceptor had been put thro=
ugh.  He did not want those actions to go unpunished.  After all, he was a =
Prime.  And as a Prime he swore to protect those under his comradeship.  He=
 becomes deeply intrenched in thought, hoping that no one would read his mi=
nd, and find out what was eating at him, since his expression could fortell=
 a bit of anger, not at his comrades but at someone else.  As deep as the h=
atred that the Autobots had for the Decepticons vorns ago.  This was that k=
ind of hatred.  He thinks deeply to himself.

" So now that the Autobots ar=
e few in numbers, you think you can just take over this universe as if you =
were an unstoppable deity.  You've harmed far too many of those I care for.=
  And what you've done to Rodimus, Nightlight, Windlord and Perceptor, are =
inexcuseable.  You have no right to the power you seek, and I will see to i=
t that you never get your hands on it.  You think you are powerful just bec=
ause you have Megatron and Galvatron's strength within your spark?  That me=
ans nothing because you haven't got what truely matters, and that kind of p=
ower is not given, it's earned.  I will face you Hydras, I swear by the nam=
e of Primus himself, I will face you."

Not one word comes out of Tucson's =
mouth, yet he begins to crack his knuckles audibly as he always does when l=
osing his temper.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyc=
lonus@...> wrote:
>
> <OLD>
> 
> > Tucson now transformed into robot mode, =
takes a seat next to Rodimus's bedside, and prepares to sit it out for a lo=
ng time, not moving from his spot. If anything else he was there for suppor=
t. He had hoped by doing so, Rodimus's condition may change gradually. Yet =
he had time to respond to Perceptor and Kup as they were leaving.
> >
> > "=
 Do what you can to help Nightlight. I'll stay with Rodimus to be sure he r=
emains stable."
> >
> > In his larger body frame, it was a bit hard for him=
 to make himself comfortable yet, to him comfort was the last thing on his =
mind. He knew he needed Rodimus not only as a comrade, but as a friend. It =
was the one thing that Hydras didn't have and a power he'd never experience=
. The power of friendship.
> >
> > " Hopefully you can hear me Rodimus. I p=
romise you as an Autobot and a Prime, that I will NEVER give up fighting un=
itl the day comes when the wars finally cease. After the wars, restoration =
is in order. But if we're going to achieve these goals, the leaders of the =
Autobots and the Maximals must come together as a whole and only then can w=
e restore order on this planet. There's just one problem, you've slipped aw=
ay on us, unintentionally of course, but without you we're not as powerful =
as we can be. But with you we can give this planet what it desperately need=
s, new hope and the promise of new life. Never give up your drive to restor=
e order, for it's a drive that we all share and treasure and a drive that n=
o evil force can ever bring down."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> As Tuscon entered the ch=
amber where Rodimus Prime is laying he can
> also see the familliar form of=
  Lagacy as he stood to the side of
> Rodimus as he looked over several of =
the sensors that were oriented on
> Rodimus' prone form lying on the bed.
>=
 
> However also in the room was Bump who while smaller than Legacy  but
> =
he looked no less formidable in his durably contructed crimson colored
> ar=
mor and silver-grey chest plate plating. His beast mode was
> probrably som=
e sort of reptile, an armadillo perhaps judging from
> hints around his for=
m. He glanced up as Tuscon entered a scalpel in
> his hand as it hummed wit=
h power.
> 
> Also was the rather large form of Santon the Maximal Doctor. =
He stood
> as tall as the Massive Legacy, his armor was thick and heavy and=
 was
> colored primarilly in various shades of greys although his chest
> t=
hights and biceps were red. As with many Maximals it was easy to
> determin=
e his beast mode was that of an elephant from the large tusks
> that extend=
ed from his helm.
> 
> 
> 
> <OLD>
> 
> > He sits up trying to get in a com=
fortable position.
> >
> > " Then there's this little matter of Hydras.. Un=
fortunately he reminds me of good old Megatron and Galvitron... If we're go=
ing to overthrow him, we have to work together. That won't be easy, but I k=
now we can do it. If anyone should be wanting to thwart him, it's you. He d=
id the most injustice to you, and by right, you have presidence as to how h=
is fate should ultimately wind up. Then, Cyclonus. I'll deal with him. Litt=
le by little we should free this planet. And little by little we can watch =
it flourish."
> >
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Santon looked up, it was obvious that he =
was not happy with yet
> another intrusion on what could turn out to be an =
incredibly delicate
> operation. "Tuscon Prime." Santon said, his voice car=
rying the full
> weight of acting chief medical officer, "I will have to as=
k you and
> any others who wish to watch to wait in the observation room." =
Santon
> pointed to the room easily visable on the other side of clear
> pl=
exiglass. He looked back at Rodimus as he heard a beep from one of
> the se=
nsors.
> 
> Legacy spoke up from his position, "It would appear that his li=
fe
> signs are begining to decline, if we are to begin, now would be the
> =
best time."
> 
> Bump glanced looked at the others in the area his look obv=
ious, leave
> so that they could begin.
